qas.question: Where are "exhibition match" and "friendly match" not synonymous?
What are two examples of leagues holding all-star exhibition matches?

answers.text: US Major League Soccer or Japan's Japanese League

qas.question: What are 'friendlies' for charity usually called in the UK?
What are 'friendlies' to honor a player usually called in the UK?
In what two countries does exhibition match and friendly match refer to the same type of game?
Who calls annual All-Star matches Friendly's?
What type of one-off match may be called a friendly?
What kind of friendly matches are held by the US major league soccer or Japan Japanese league?

context: In <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>the UK and Ireland<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, "exhibition match" and "friendly match" refer to two different types of matches. The types described above as friendlies are not termed exhibition matches, while <b7_0>annual all-star matches<b7_0/> such as those held in the <a1_0>US Major League Soccer or Japan's Japanese League<a1_0/> are called exhibition matches rather than friendly matches. A one-off match <b6_0>for charitable fundraising<b6_0/>, usually involving one or two all-star teams, or a match held in honor of a player for contribution to his/her club, may also be described as exhibition matches but they are normally referred to as <a2_0>charity matches<a2_0/> and <a3_0>testimonial matches<a3_0/> respectively.
